meanings.definition: A level or rank in an organization or society.
meanings.sent1: In the company, the top echelons make all the important decisions.
meanings.sent2: She worked hard to climb the echelons of the corporate ladder.
meanings.sent3: At the school bake sale, the cookie echelons were the most popular.
meanings.sent4: The echelons of power can sometimes seem unreachable to those at the bottom.
meanings.sent5: The echelons of society often dictate who holds the most influence.

meanings.definition: A formation of troops in which units are arranged in parallel lines.
meanings.sent1: The military commander organized the troops into precise echelons for the parade.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers marched in perfect echelons during the training exercise.
meanings.sent3: During the mock battle, the toy soldiers formed colorful echelons on the playroom floor.
meanings.sent4: The geese flying in V-shaped echelons across the sky were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers moved in graceful echelons, creating a mesmerizing display.
